SENT.plain: Angiotensinogen (AGT) and plasminogen activator inhibitor-1 (PAI-1) are expressed in both vascular and adipose tissues
Angiotensin II (AG II) has an adipogenic effect and increases PAI-1 expression

To evaluate the chronic effects of AG II type 1 receptor (AT(1)R) antagonism on adipose mass and PAI-1 expression in vascular and adipose tissues, losartan (30mg/kg/day) was administered to Otsuka Long-Evans Tokushima Fatty (OLETF) rats, a model of type 2 diabetes, for 20 weeks
Adipose mass and regional fat distribution in the abdomen did not change after chronic AT(1)R antagonism in OLETF rats
AGT and PAI-1 mRNA expressions in adipose tissue of OLETF rats were significantly increased compared with Long-Evans Tokushima Otsuka (LETO) rats, the normal control
Chronic losartan therapy further increased the level of adipose AGT in OLETF rats, but did not affect the level of adipose PAI-1 mRNA
In contrast, aortic PAI-1 expression in OLETF rats was attenuated by chronic losartan therapy
First, adipose tissue may be an important source of AG II in metabolic syndrome even after chronic losartan therapy
Second, chronic AT(1)R antagonism with losartan causes differential effects on vascular and adipose PAI-1 expression
